groups.name: Unknown

groups.name: Monthly Maintenance
groups.comments: Maintenance steps to be performed on a monthly basis to ensure codebase health.

groups.name: CodeMods

sections.name: React 19 Upgrade
sections.comments: Steps to upgrade the codebase to React 19. (Note: Upgrade to 19.2 is another set.)

code.content: Test responsive design works correctly for all media types (screen, print, speech).
Test print styles render correctly - verify page breaks, margins, and print-specific CSS.
Test screen display renders correctly across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports.
Test layout adapts correctly for portrait orientation (mobile/tablet). Verify no horizontal overflow.
Test layout utilizes landscape orientation effectively (wide screens). Verify readable line lengths.
Test light color scheme has sufficient contrast ratios (WCAG AA) and no visual artifacts.
Test dark color scheme has sufficient contrast ratios, no pure blacks/whites causing eye strain, and respects user preference.

items.name: Check for styles that are overwritten (browser inspect)

code.content: Validate Entries

items.name: Remove type from stylesheet ref (no longer required)

code.content: Empty alt
Valid alt
Valid title

items.name: Chrome DevTools: Validate state - Check for unused state
Chrome DevTools: Check network tab for missing files (images), connection issues, etc.
Inspect style: Click through elements to check for unused or invalid styles.
Set 'object-shorthand' to 'always' or 'warn' in 'rules' section. Property shorthand allows you to omit the property name when it matches the variable name, making the code cleaner.
TSConfig.json - Check for new and deprecated options Typescript

code.content: npm doctor
npm dedupe
npm audit

items.name: npm audit - Check for package vulnerabilities

code.content: npm outdated

items.name: npm outdated - Check for package updates

code.content: npm prune
Measure Cumulative Layout Shift using Chrome DevTools or PageSpeed Insights. Target: 0.1 or lower.

items.name: Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) - visual stability of a page as it loads

code.content: Measure Interaction to Next Paint using Chrome DevTools. Target: 200ms or less. Replace FID measurements.

items.name: Interaction to Next Paint (INP) - measures user interface responsiveness.  replaces First Input Delay (FID)

code.content: Measure Largest Contentful Paint using Chrome DevTools or Lighthouse. Target: 2.5 seconds or less.

items.name: Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) - time between the browser starting to load a page and the largest content element appearing
Input - Click on Label
items.goal: Clicking the label sets focus to or activates the form control

items.name: 1. Enter value 2. Save 3. Delete value 4. Save
Typescript Improvements - Using typescript [latest version], are there any improvements that can be implemented?
Javascript Improvements - Using javascript ES2025, are there any improvements that can be be implemented?
Javascript Improvements2 - Update to use findLast(), findLastIndex(), toSorted(), and toReversed() where applicable.
Javascript ES2023 Array Method Improvements - Update to use findLast(), findLastIndex(), toSorted(), and toReversed() where applicable.
Javascript Iterable Type Updates - Update to use Iterable where applicable.
Javascript Iterable Type Updates - Update to use RegExp.escape where applicable.
Javascript RegExp.escape Implementation - Update to use RegExp.escape where applicable.
Javascript RegExp.escape Implementation - Update to use Promise.try where applicable.

items.notes: 12/25/2025 - Limited browser support.  Check compatibility before implementing (caniuse.com)
items.name: Javascript Iteratable - Implement Temporal API.
React Improvements - Are there react 19.2.3 enhancements that can be made?
HTML5 - Is the latest and appropriate HTML5 elements used?
CSS - Are there improvements to CSS that can be made?
Styles - Are there any styles defined in components that should be moved to main.css?
Immutable - Look for opportunties to improve Immutability in codebase.

SOLID - Validate use of SOLID [ Single Responsibility Principle (SRP),  Open/Closed Principle (OCP), Liskov Substitution Principle (LSP), Interface Segregation Principle (ISP), Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP) ] principles in codebase.
Class Components - Convert any class components to functional components and hooks.
Lazy Loading - Implement lazy loading components.
Re-renders - Look for any unnecessary re-renders.
Scripts: Type Check - npm run type-check
Scripts: Lint Fix - npm run lint:fix

items.notes: Find unused files, dependencies, and exports
items.name: Scripts: Knip - npm run knip
Error Handling - Review error handling patterns across the codebase and suggest improvements for user-facing error messages and error recovery
Accessibility - Analyze accessibility (a11y) issues - check for proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, focus management, and screen reader support
React Query Optimization - Review and optimize React Query usage - check staleTime, cacheTime, retry logic, and identify opportunities for prefetching
Custom Hooks - Identify opportunities to create custom hooks to reduce duplication and improve code reusability
API Security - Review API security - validate input sanitization, rate limiting effectiveness, and error information exposure
Bundle Size - Analyze bundle size and suggest code splitting opportunities beyond lazy loading

items.notes: Some of these feel too strict: e.g., noImplicitAny, strictNullChecks, strictFunctionTypes
items.name: TypeScript Strict Mode - Review TypeScript strict mode usage and suggest enabling stricter compiler options
Prop Drilling - Identify prop drilling issues and suggest Context API or state management improvements
Styled Components Performance - Review styled-components usage and identify performance issues or patterns to improve
Testing - Suggest implementing React Testing Library tests for critical user flows
Form Validation - Review form validation patterns and suggest consistency improvements using Zod or similar
SSR/SSG - Identify opportunities for Server-Side Rendering or Static Site Generation
Image Optimization - Review and optimize image loading strategies (lazy loading, responsive images, WebP)
API Caching - Analyze API response caching strategies and suggest improvements
Memory Leaks - Check for memory leaks - useEffect cleanup, event listeners, subscriptions
Build - execute npm run build and fix all errors

code.content: Add 3 strict flags to client tsconfig: noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns, exactOptionalPropertyTypes
Verify sanitizeFilePath is applied to all file upload/manipulation endpoints
Implement CSRF token generation and validation for mutation endpoints - future implementation
Implement authentication and authorization middleware (JWT, sessions, or OAuth) - future implementation
Configure Web Application Firewall rules for production deployment - future implementation

items.notes: 12/1/2025 - 'es2025' is not supported by Vite.  Use 'esnext' instead. This is need for features like Promise.try

code.content: check tsconfig.json and update target and lib to 'esnext' (lower case)

items.name: Javascript Version - esnext

code.content: Add a display name to every component if missing.  Add the name before the component export.

Comprehensive ESLint review: 1) Suggest additional linters/plugins, 2) Check for deprecated or missing rules, 3) Identify conflicting or duplicate rules across config files, 4) Validate rule severity levels are appropriate.
Replace ESLint and Prettier with Biome
Are there any deprecated Typescript or Javascript functions being used?
Review eslint.config files.  Are there any conflicting or duplicate rules?

Review the code for anti-patterns (God objects, tight coupling, callback hell, excessive prop drilling, magic numbers, hard-coded values, nested ternaries, massive functions >50 lines) and suggest specific refactoring improvements.
Read the package.json files and review the libraries used. Are there suggested replacements for any libraries?
Read the vite.config.mts file and suggest improvements.
Read the vitest.config.ts file and suggest improvements.
Read the tsconfig.node.json file and suggest improvements.
Are there any files at the src/ level not being used?
Read the tsconfig.json file and suggest improvements.
Read the knip.json file and suggest improvements.
Read the index.html file and suggest improvements.
Read the .gitignore file and suggest improvements.
Read the .prettierignore file and suggest improvements.
Read the .prettierrc.mjs file and suggest improvements.
Check if babel.cjs is needed (Vitest uses Vite, not Babel). Delete if unused.
Check if eslint_rules/ directory is used. Delete if migrated to flat config.
Calculate the maintainability index of the codebase and suggest improvements if below 85.

code.content: Look for code smells in client and server codebases.
Look for code duplication in client and server codebases and recommend refactoring.
Look for security vulnerabilities in client and server codebases and recommend improvements.
Look for structural issues in client and server codebases and recommend improvements.
useEffectEvent is stable.  Look for opportunities in the code to use this function.
Create Skeleton components for loading states to improve user experience during data fetching.
Ensure that all ids in the data are sequential and unique to maintain data integrity.
Add light-dark() function to main.css for consistent theming.
Replace all named colors in components with CSS variables defined in main.css for easier theming and maintenance.
Remove unused or redundant CSS rules from the codebase to improve maintainability and performance.
Review all the Server API end points for consistency in naming conventions, request/response formats, and error handling.
Review all the Server API end points to validate that PUT, POST, PATCH, and DELETE requests do not have parameters: all data should be in the request body.  Fix any related routers and services.
Review all the Client API requests to validate that PUT, POST, PATCH, and DELETE requests do not have parameters: all data should be in the request body.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the new useActionState hook introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the new useTransition hook introduced in React 19.
Remove useFormState
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the new useOptimistic hook introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the new use hook introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to update Context.Provider to Context introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to update cleanup functions for ref introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the new useDeferredValue hook introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the stylesheet precedence changes introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the resource preloading changes introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to identify opportunities to use the error handling changes introduced in React 19.
Review all the code to validate that the new JSX transform introduced in React 19 is being used correctly.
run replace-reactdom-render

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-use-form-state
items.comments: This codemod will replace the usages of useFormState() to use useActionState(), introduced in React v19.

items.comments: This codemod will convert the usage of useContext to the new hook format, introduced in React v19.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/migration-recipe

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - migration-recipe
items.comments: This codemod run the following: replace-reactdom-render replace-string-ref replace-act-import replace-use-form-state prop-types-typescript

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-reactdom-render

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-reactdom-render
items.comments: Replaces usages of ReactDom.render() with createRoot(node).render().

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-string-ref

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-string-ref
items.comments: Replaces deprecated string refs with callback refs.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-act-import

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-act-import
items.comments: Updates act import path from react-dom/test-utils to react.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/replace-use-form-state

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - replace-use-form-state
items.comments: Replaces usages of useFormState() to use useActionState().

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - prop-types-typescript

run replace-act-import
run replace-use-form-state
run prop-types-typescript

items.notes: 01/01/2026: Score: 94/100 - Excellent consistency across coding styles, naming conventions, and file structures. Coding Style Consistency - Naming conventions, code formatting, patterns; File Structure Consistency - Directory organization, file naming; API Pattern Consistency - Handler patterns, error responses, validation; TypeScript Usage - Type annotations, generic usage; Import Patterns - Import organization, factory usage; Error Handling Consistency - ResponseHelper usage, error formats; Documentation Consistency - JSDoc comments, inline comments; Testing Patterns - Test structure (if tests exist)

code.content: Analyze codebase for optimization opportunities: rendering performance (memoization, virtualization), bundle size (code splitting, lazy loading), API efficiency (caching, batching), memory usage (cleanup, leaks). For each suggestion, explain expected improvement and trade-offs.

[paste function]

Include tests for:
1. Normal expected inputs
2. Edge cases
3. Invalid inputs

Use [preferred testing framework] syntax.
Look for component instability issues - identify components that frequently re-render unnecessarily and suggest optimizations to stabilize them.

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Score 98/100 - Excellent. Zero functional duplicates. TypeScript version aligned (5.9.3). Consider workspace for husky/prettier/eslint deduplication (optional).

code.content: Review the package.json files for duplicate libraries - libraries that perform the same function(s) but are different packages. Suggest consolidating to a single library where possible.

items.name: Package.json - Duplicate Libraries

code.content: Review for non-optimized imports that may break tree shaking - suggest improvements to ensure optimal bundle size.

items.notes: 01/02/2026: Score 88/100 - Very Good. 8 redundant boolean attributes (={false}) to remove. Zero unused variables. Fragment patterns with Meta are correct React 18+ practice. Key usage excellent (95%+).

code.content: Review codebase to ensure clean JSX - suggest improvements to remove unnecessary fragments, redundant attributes, and unused variables.

items.name: Clean JSX

code.content: Here's a piece of performance-critical React code: [paste code]. Suggest optimizations to improve rendering efficiency and explain the expected improvement for each suggestion.

Act as a meticulous code reviewer. Analyze the following React component for potential performance bottlenecks, lack of accessibility (ARIA) compliance, and any deviation from standard React best practices. Suggest specific, actionable improvements for each identified issue, explaining the rationale behind each recommendation. Here is the component code: [paste code].
Search for React components using array index as key prop (e.g., key={index}). Report occurrences and suggest using stable unique identifiers instead to prevent rendering bugs.
Review React components returning fragments containing only <Meta> or <Helmet> tags. Verify this pattern is intentional for SEO/metadata injection and not an oversight.
Find and remove redundant boolean JSX attributes (e.g., disabled={true} should be disabled, hidden={false} should be omitted). Report count and suggest automatic fixes.
Scan for hardcoded secrets (API keys, passwords, tokens) in codebase and environment files. Verify .gitignore excludes sensitive files.
Run accessibility audit: Check for missing alt text, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation support, color contrast ratios (WCAG AA), and semantic HTML usage.

items.status: Passed - Error boundaries at app and layout levels with fallbacks

code.content: Allow and implement any TC39 Stage 2+ features in the codebase, ensuring compatibility with current build tools and environments. Update ESlint rules to allow these features.

npm install -g npm@11.7.0.

items.name: Package.json - Overrides
items.comments: Overrides can complicate dependency resolution. Ensure each override is justified.

items.name: Node Modules Cleanup
items.comments: Stop the app and manually delete the node_modules directory in both client and server folders. Then run npm install in each folder to reinstall dependencies afresh.

items.name: Dist Folder Cleanup
items.comments: Stop the app and manually delete the dist directory in both client and server folders. Then run the build script in each folder to regenerate the distribution files.

items.name: ESLint Health Check
items.comments: ESLint has a habit of silently stopping. Ensure it is running correctly and address any issues promptly. Go to Ouput | ESLint console.

code.content: Rebuild the project from GitHub (or whatever source repo you are using). 1. Make a backup copy. 2. Delete the current project. 3. Restore and validate.

items.name: Rebuild Project From Scratch
items.comments: Validate that you have all your code in source control, that you have documentation on how to build the project, and a new developer can pick up the project and run with it.

items.name: Node.js - Update

code.content: npx codemod@latest class-to-function-component

items.comments: Transform React class components to modern function components with hooks.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/update-react-imports

items.name: React - CodeMods - update-react-imports
items.comments: Transforms React imports to use named imports instead of default or namespace imports. This helps reduce bundle size by allowing better tree-shaking of unused React exports.

items.name: React - CodeMods - create-element-to-jsx
items.comments: Transforms React.createElement calls into JSX syntax, making your code more readable and maintainable.

items.comments: Moves HOC calls to the global scope for better performance with React Router.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/remove-memoization

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - remove-memoization
items.comments: Removes manual memoization hooks: useCallback, useMemo and memo. This goes hand in hand with React Compiler. Note: This is not a safe codemod, as the compiler isn't 1-1 with inserting useMemo/useCallback.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/remove-legacy-context

items.name: React 19 - CodeMods - remove-legacy-context
items.comments: Removes legacy context methods childContextTypes and getChildContext from React class components. Wraps rendered children with Context.

code.content: npx codemod@latest react/19/remove-forward-ref
